AIConfiguration.msdyn_customconfiguration:
{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"Analyze this Power Platform Solution "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"_20technical_20design_20document"},{"type":"literal","text":" (in HTML format) and provide: { "summary": "A concise executive summary of the solution", "overview": "A detailed narrative overview of the solution's purpose and implementation" } Summary (150-200 words) Create an executive summary that: Identifies solution name, version, and core purpose. Highlights the business problem solved. Outlines key technical capabilities. Emphasizes end-user benefits. Notes essential integrations or dependencies. Overview (300-400 words) Develop a narrative that: Describes business context and specific problems addressed. Explains workflow transformations and operational impacts. Analyzes technical architecture holistically, not as component lists. Identifies implementation complexities and their solutions. Shows how applications, interfaces, and automations interconnect. Incorporates insights from any architecture/ER diagrams. Addresses security and data management approaches. Concludes with expected business impact. Guidelines Connect technical features to business outcomes. Infer relationships between components when not explicit. Balance insights for both technical and operational stakeholders. Analyze any diagrams for architectural patterns and key relationships. Prioritize synthesis over reorganization"}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"_20technical_20design_20document","text":" technical design document","type":"text","quickTestValue":"Table( // This first item is to provide all the information necessary related to solution details for the doc preview component // It is important to set the visibility to false and set -{ SolutionDetailItemKey: "SolutionDetails"} { SolutionDetailItemKey: "SolutionDetails", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "", SolutionDetailItemValue: varSolutionDetails, SolutionDetailItemVisible: false, SolutionDetailItemHTML: "" }, // Document Heading { SolutionDetailItemKey: "title", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true, SolutionDetailItemHTML: "

Technical Design Document for Asset Managements

" }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: DocumentSectionString.Overview, SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true,//!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.Overview, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: "

Overview

" // Used to generate navigation header }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: DocumentSectionString.Overview, SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true,//!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.Overview, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: "

This technical design document outlines the Asset Management System (AMS), covering its key features, technical specifications, requirements, and architectural considerations. The purpose of this document is to provide a structured guide for understanding, implementing, and maintaining the Asset Management System within an organization.

" }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: "Solution-Detail", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "Solution Detail", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true,//!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.SolutionDetails, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: "
  • Solution Name: Asset Management System
  • Display Name: Asset Manager Pro
  • Unique Name: AssetManagerProApp
  • Version Number: 2.1.0.3
  • Created Date: 01 January 2024, 00:00:00 UTC
  • Modified Date: 01 February 2024, 12:00:00 UTC
" } , { SolutionDetailItemKey: "solutionarchitecture", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "Solution Diagram", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true,//!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.SolutionDetails, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: Substitute( Substitute( Mermaid2PngSolutionDiagram.MermaidPNG, "visibility:hidden", "" ), "
  • Environmental Variable 1: Database Connection URL – Connection string for the central asset database
  • Environmental Variable 2: Authentication Key – API key for external integrations
  • Connection Reference 1: Power BI Integration – Required for visual reporting and dashboard functionality
  • Connection Reference 2: Azure Blob Storage – Storage solution for asset-related documents
    • " }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: DocumentSectionString.UXAndAutomations, SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true,//!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.UXAndAutomations, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: "

    User Experience(UX) and Automations

    " // Used to generate }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: "ux-automations", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true, //!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.UXAndAutomations, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: "

    This section includes detailed descriptions of the user experience and automation processes involved in the Sample Power App.

    " }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: DocumentSectionString.Apps, SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "Apps", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true, //!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.Apps, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: "
    • Asset Manager Web App: A web-based application that allows users to manage assets, view reports, and track lifecycle events.
    • Asset Tracker Mobile App: A mobile app enabling on-site staff to log asset conditions, update status, and scan asset tags via QR codes.
    " }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: "custom-controls", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "Custom Controls", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true, SolutionDetailItemHTML: "

    This section includes custom UI elements that enhance the user experience and extend the app functionality.

    " }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: "data-security", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "Data and Security", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true, SolutionDetailItemHTML: "

    Details on data security, custom roles, data models, entities, and entity relationships.

    " }, { SolutionDetailItemKey: "ER Diagram", SolutionDetailItemDisplayName: "Entity Relationship Diagram", SolutionDetailItemValue: Blank(), SolutionDetailItemVisible: true,//!IsBlank(Find(DocumentSectionString.SolutionDetails, Self.SelectedConfigValue)), SolutionDetailItemHTML: Substitute( Substitute( Mermaid2PngERDiagram.MermaidPNG, "visibility:hidden", "" ), ""&Substitute(Mermaid2PngERDiagram.MermaidPNG, "visibility:hidden", "width: 100%;height: 100%;object-fit: cover;")&"" }/"}],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["json"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"summary":{"type":"string"},"overview":{"type":"string"}}},"jsonExamples":[{"summary":"The Asset Management System (AMS) is a comprehensive solution designed to streamline asset tracking and management processes within organizations. Version 2.1.0.3, created on January 1, 2024, aims to address the challenges of inefficient asset management that often lead to increased operational costs and reduced productivity. Key technical capabilities include a web-based application for asset management, a mobile app for on-site updates, and integrations with Power BI for reporting and Azure Blob Storage for document management. End-users benefit from enhanced visibility into asset status and lifecycle events, leading to improved decision-making. The solution relies on essential integrations with external services for data storage and reporting functionalities, ensuring a cohesive operational framework.","overview":"The Asset Management System (AMS) is implemented to address significant challenges in asset management faced by organizations, such as tracking asset conditions, managing lifecycle events, and generating insightful reports. The solution enables seamless workflow transformations by automating asset tracking processes and providing real-time data access through both web and mobile applications. The technical architecture of AMS incorporates various components, including a central database for asset information, user-friendly interfaces for different user roles, and automated workflows that enhance operational efficiency. Implementation complexities include ensuring robust data security, managing API integrations, and maintaining system performance under varying loads. Solutions to these complexities involve the establishment of custom roles for data access, thorough testing of integrations, and performance optimization strategies. The integration of applications, interfaces, and automations is designed to provide a holistic view of asset management, with insights drawn from the architecture and entity relationship diagrams. Data management strategies prioritize security and compliance while facilitating easy access to necessary information. The expected business impact includes reduced operational costs, improved asset utilization, and enhanced reporting capabilities that drive informed decision-making across the organization."}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"default","gptParameters":{"temperature":0.5}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null,"runtime":null}}

{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"Given a collection of Power Automate objects "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"flowJSON"},{"type":"literal","text":" , generate a structured result JSON that summarizes each flow. The output should include a list of all flows, with each entry containing the following details:
Name: Extract the flow name. 
Description: Summarize the flow’s purpose in a most meaningful way and with its key operations/purpose.
Triggers: Identify and list the triggers that initiate the flow.
Actions: Provide a detailed list of actions performed by the flow.
Ensure that:
The output JSON is structured as an array where each element represents a single flow summary. Each flow’s details are extracted from its respective JSON object. The result JSON is technical, professional and clean, making it suitable for generating an HTML interface.

Expected JSON Output format
 {
 "Name": "OrderProcessingFlow",
 "Description": "Automates the order processing workflow, including sending confirmation emails and updating order status.",
 "Triggers": [
 "New order created"
 ],
 "Actions": [
 "Send email",
 "Update order status",
 "Log activity"
 ]
 }"}],"definitions":{"inputs":[{"id":"flowJSON","text":"flowJSON","type":"text","quickTestValue":" {
 "name": "BACore | Update Active Published Workflow",
 "primaryEntity": "none",
 "category": "Modern Flow",
 "json": "{ \"properties\": { \"connectionReferences\": { \"shared_commondataserviceforapps_1\": { \"runtimeSource\": \"embedded\", \"connection\": { \"connectionReferenceLogicalName\": \"cat_BusinessApprovalKitDataverse\" }, \"api\": { \"name\": \"shared_commondataserviceforapps\" } } }, \"definition\": { \"$schema\": \"https://schema.management.azure.com/providers/Microsoft.Logic/schemas/2016-06-01/workflowdefinition.json#\", \"contentVersion\": \"1.0.0.0\", \"parameters\": { \"$connections\": { \"defaultValue\": {}, \"type\": \"Object\" }, \"$authentication\": { \"defaultValue\": {}, \"type\": \"SecureObject\" } }, \"triggers\": { \"Update_Published_Workflow_when_a_version_is_activated\": { \"metadata\": { \"operationMetadataId\": \"1877681b-e29b-4d9b-ba40-c95e154fca60\" }, \"type\": \"OpenApiConnectionWebhook\", \"inputs\": { \"host\": { \"connectionName\": \"shared_commondataserviceforapps_1\", \"operationId\": \"SubscribeWebhookTrigger\", \"apiId\": \"/providers/Microsoft.PowerApps/apis/shared_commondataserviceforapps\" }, \"parameters\": { \"subscriptionRequest/message\": 3, \"subscriptionRequest/entityname\": \"cat_businessapprovalversion\", \"subscriptionRequest/scope\": 4, \"subscriptionRequest/filteringattributes\": \"statecode\", \"subscriptionRequest/filterexpression\": \"statecode eq 0\", \"subscriptionRequest/runas\": 1 }, \"authentication\": \"@parameters('$authentication')\" } } }, \"actions\": { \"Run_a_Child_Flow\": { \"runAfter\": {}, \"metadata\": { \"operationMetadataId\": \"2a9dbf5f-bb9c-4a37-bd34-8c584cdd27f9\" }, \"type\": \"Workflow\", \"inputs\": { \"host\": { \"workflowReferenceName\": \"e46573c9-d86f-ed11-81ac-000d3a09c30d\" }, \"body\": { \"text\": \"@triggerOutputs()?['body/cat_businessapprovalversionid']\", \"text_1\": \"@triggerOutputs()?['body/_cat_process_value']\" } } } } }, \"templateName\": null }, \"schemaVersion\": \"1.0.0.0\" }\r\n"
 }"}],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["json"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"Name":{"type":"string"},"Description":{"type":"string"},"Triggers":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"item":{"type":"string"}},"required":["item"]}},"Actions":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"item":{"type":"string"}},"required":["item"]}}}},"jsonExamples":[{"Name":"BACore | Update Active Published Workflow","Description":"Automates the update of active published workflows when a new version is activated.","Triggers":[{"item":"Update_Published_Workflow_when_a_version_is_activated"}],"Actions":[{"item":"Run_a_Child_Flow"}]}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"gpt-4","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null}}

{"version":"GptDynamicPrompt-2","prompt":[{"type":"literal","text":"Given a collection of Power Automate objects "},{"type":"inputVariable","id":"flowJSON"},{"type":"literal","text":" , generate a structured result JSON that summarizes each flow. The output should include a list of all flows, with each entry containing the following details:
Name: Extract the flow name.

 }"}],"data":[],"output":{"formats":["json"],"jsonSchema":{"type":"object","properties":{"Name":{"type":"string"},"Description":{"type":"string"},"Triggers":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"item":{"type":"string"}},"required":["item"]}},"Actions":{"type":"array","items":{"type":"object","properties":{"item":{"type":"string"}},"required":["item"]}}}},"jsonExamples":[{"Name":"BACore | Update Active Published Workflow","Description":"Automates the update of active published workflows when a version is activated.","Triggers":[{"item":"Update_Published_Workflow_when_a_version_is_activated"}],"Actions":[{"item":"Run a Child Flow"}]}]}},"modelParameters":{"modelType":"advanced","gptParameters":{"temperature":0}},"settings":{"recordRetrievalLimit":30,"shouldPreserveRecordLinks":null,"runtime":null}}

connectionreference.description: Office 365 Outlook used for sending email
